Gelar Rapat, Pemerintah Bahas Opsi TPPI Jadi BUMN
05 Nov 2019, 04:41 by Dias Prasongko, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kementerian Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian hari ini, 5 November 2019, mengelar rapat koordinasi tentang optimalisasi PT Trans Pacific Petrochemical Indotama (TPPI). Kementerian masih melihat lebih lanjut terkait kemungkinan TPPI menjadi Badan Usaha Milik Negara (BUMN).
Menteri Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian Airlangga Hartarto mengatakan pemerintah memiliki opsi menjadikan TPPI sebagai perusahaan BUMN. Apalagi saham terbesarnya saat ini dimiliki oleh PT Pertamina (Persero).
Kendati demikian, kata Airlangga, pemerintah masih melihat lebih jauh mengenai opsi ini. "Ini kita lihat dulu strukturnya, meski sekarang sudah bagian dari BUMN karena saham terbesarnya kan Pertamina," kata Airlangga di kantornya, Jakarta Pusat, Selasa 5 November 2019.
Adapun sejumlah menteri terlihat berkumpul di kantor Kementerian Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian. Mulai Menteri BUMN Erick Thohir, Menteri Perindustrian Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, Direktur Utama PT Pertamina Nicke Widyawati. Selain itu, Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati dijadwalkan hadir dalam rapat ini.
Sebelumnya, pemerintah resmi mengempit 96 persen saham TPPI. Selama ini, perusahaan yang terletak di Tuban, Jawa Timur itu hanya difungsikan sebagai pengolah minyak dan petrokimia.
Meski sahamnya telah dimiliki pemerintah, status perusahaan TPPI belum jelas. Karenanya, Menteri Koordinator Bidang Kemaritiman Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan sempat mengusulkan supaya TPPI menjadi BUMN usai bertemu dengan Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi
Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi sebelumnya telah meneken Peraturan Pemerintah (PP) 66 Tahun 2019 tentang Penambahan PMN Republik Indonesia ke Dalam Modal Saham TPI. Dengan ditekennya beleid tersebut, utang TPPI yang mencapai Rp 2,62 triliun kini dikonversi menjadi 157,91 ribu lembar saham.

DIAS PRASONGKO
text:
Holds Meeting, Government Discuss TPPI Option as SOE
05 Nov 2019, 04:41 by Dias Prasongko, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs today, 5 November 2019, held a coordination meeting on optimizing PT Trans Pacific Petrochemical Indotama (TPPI). The Ministry is still looking further into the possibility of the TPPI becoming a State-Owned Enterprise (BUMN).
Coordinating Minister for the Economy Airlangga Hartarto said the government had the option to make the TPPI a state-owned company. Moreover, its biggest share is currently owned by PT Pertamina (Persero).
Nevertheless, said Airlangga, the government still saw further about this option. "We will see the structure first, although now it is part of BUMN because Pertamina is the biggest shareholder," said Airlangga in his office, Central Jakarta, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
Meanwhile, a number of ministers were seen gathering in the office of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs. Starting from SOE Minister Erick Thohir, Industry Minister Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, President Director of PT Pertamina Nicke Widyawati. In addition, Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati was scheduled to attend the meeting.
Previously, the government officially narrowed 96 percent of TPPI shares. So far, the company, located in Tuban, East Java, has only functioned as an oil and petrochemical processor.
Although the shares are owned by the government, the TPPI company's status is not yet clear. Therefore, the Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan had suggested that the TPPI become a BUMN after meeting with President Joko Widodo or Jokowi
President Joko Widodo or Jokowi has previously signed Government Regulation (PP) 66 of 2019 concerning Addition of PMN of the Republic of Indonesia to TPI Equity Capital. With the signing of the regulation, TPPI's debt which reached Rp 2.62 trillion has now been converted to 157.91 thousand shares.

DIAS PRASONGKO
